results.description:
Programming 101: Pen and Paper Coding is an introductory programming class taught using pen and paper only in NYC. 

Our method helps prevent any distractions that occur when using a computer too early on in the learning process, while students focus on getting a solid grasp of the fundamentals of computer programming. 

The goals of the course are ambitious, and the curriculum covers a lot of the materials taught in a typical “Programming 101” course at computer science departments around the world.  

The course consists of 5 sessions, meeting once a week for five consecutive weeks. Group size is between 4-8 students + an experienced instructor. The course fee is $399, and includes all 5 sessions, video recordings of each class, as well as a textbook written by the main instructor specifically for this course. The course is held at Impact Hub (394 Broadway @ Walker St) (nyc.impacthub.net).

Join this Meetup group to stay informed about our courses and visit www.penpapercoding.com for more information!

Come, join us for a dynamic programming class that delivers!

The Pen and Paper Coding Team
results.name: The Pen and Paper Coding Class

results.description:
China-US International Trade Networking is a bridge to bring Chinese manufacturers and US business owners together, a platform to share relevant experience & knowledge, make friends and meet potential business partners!

Background:

International trade has flourished over the years because of the many benefits it has offered to different countries across the globe. China, as the world’s biggest exporter, and the United States, as the world’s biggest importer, are two major trade players. However, due to language and geographical issues, there still has been a gap between U.S. and China’s businessmen/businesswomen in terms of information symmetry and efficiency of resource integration.

We understand that the businessmen/businesswomen in the U.S. are eager to find accessible sources of high quality products with lower cost, and at the same time, a number of giant manufacturers in China are looking for opportunities to expand their global sales networks and sell their products in a more cost-efficient way.

Our Mission:

We believe that the trade between both sides could be organized in a more ACCESSIBLE and EFFICIENT way, and therefore we set up this meet up to help you find your best business partners from China.

Industries Included:

HOLIDAY SUPPLIES/COSTUMES, GIFTS, TOYS, APPAREL, SHOES, EYEWEAR FRAMES, GARDEN EQUIPMENTS, STEEL, etc.

We are open to people/companies from other industries too!

Our Advantage:

- RESOURCE INTEGRATION (With our strong connection with competitive Chinese manufacturers, we could help you quickly identify and match your best-fit business partners from China!)

- NETWORK EXPANSION (Meet up with people have different background but share the same interest!)

- TECHNICAL EXPERTISE (We have a group of experts with a diverse background!)

If you wish to empower your future business backed by reliable manufacturers from China, do not hesitate to take the chance, and JOIN US right now!
results.name: China & US International Trade Networking

Psychology Dinners is another social innovation experiment created by Glen Brauer inspired from the ongoing success of Philosophy Dinners (PhilosophyDinners.org). Click here to view some feedback from previous Philosophy Dinners events held in cities around the world.

This group is for people who value fun and engaging discussions with intelligent, open-minded and friendly people. This Meetup group was created as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical psychology to bring together strangers and build community.


When will the first event take place?

This depends on how long it takes for members to join this Meetup group.  Typically a Meetup group requires at least 30 members in order to get a turnout of at least 6 people.


What will be the topic for the first event?

I will be sending out a poll to decide that once enough members join this group.


The format for these events will be very similar to Philosophy Dinners:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought videos provided in advance of event 

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided by Glen Brauer to the facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.


There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.


The Psychology Dinners Facebook Group

The purpose of the Psychology Dinners Facebook group is to cultivate the global citizen mindset; by enriching our perspectives through the sharing of insights before and after the events take place in our individual cities.

Click here to join the Psychology Dinners Facebook Group


For more information please visit our home page:

http://www.psychologydinners.org
results.name: New York Psychology Dinners

results.description:
We believe that programming languages, like spoken languages, require a close-knit user community in order to thrive. Scala Stammtisch is founded to bring people together who want to learn, share, and improve functional programming in Scala.

According to Wikipedia, “A Stammtisch is an informal group meeting held on a regular basis, and also the usually large, often round table around which the group meets. A Stammtisch is not a structured meeting, but rather a friendly get-together.”

We are the Scala Stammtisch of NYC, and we invite you to the table.

Format

While most technical meetups optimize for one-to-many communication, Scala Stammtisch aims for 15-to-15 discussion of technical topics.

We discuss one topic in a month’s worth of weekly meetups. Three discussions of the same material repeat on a fixed schedule each week; members should plan to attend only one of these. A fourth gathering takes place in an even less structured, and potentially raucous, setting.

The first 3 meetups for a topic will have an RSVP limit of 15. We will take attendance and no-shows will not be tolerated in the group, though members may change their RSVP with impunity from the time of the announcement up until 12pm of the day of the meetup.
results.name: Scala Stammtisch

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
"Conversations around timeless articles from weeklies and dailies and search for intelligent life among neighbors" is for people who read serious journalism in search for “the best, which has been thought and said”, and want to discuss their finds with likeminded readers.

This is an article discussion meetup for people whose main interest are books. Why article rather than book discussion group then? A book discussion group is not for people who take books seriously, i.e. “have a sense of purpose for reading” (Daniel Bell). They cannot take a detour from the reading path defined by their own questions and interests even for sake of finding people they speak the same language with. An article discussion group allows finding people of the same quality as a book group while making much lesser demand on your reading time.

A serious magazine or newspaper seems to be the only place where you can find intelligent life in public space. Good periodicals might be the only link between people who think. This is the reason for creating the meetup.

This group is for readers who from time to time come across a fascinating article and want to discuss it with others both for better understanding of things and for pleasure of being with people who share your interests.

I am talking about an occasional outstanding article with eye-opening analysis or a review of a great book (just published or classic), not about daily reporting.

For sake of describing this group I’d like to restate the obvious - a few of many things that one may get from a good newspaper if he goes past news:
1. Understanding political world we live in - insightful analysis of major issues of politics – both domestic and foreign;
2. Opportunity to hear people with greater wisdom and knowledge than your own (in our interactions in person we are usually limited to people of our own level);
3. Invaluable tips for continuing study of Humanities on your own;
4. Knowledge for dealing with earthly problems of our lives.

It is easy to miss and never discover articles and tips about books that would be of most interest to you or even “change your life” because there are too many worthy newspapers and magazines for one person to keep up with. It is another reason for this meetup.

Articles will not be limited to current ones. Selection criteria are topic and quality - publication date does not matter – we will be discussing pieces that are “timeless”.
A sample list of articles that follows this description will give you an idea of what kind of things we may discuss. People with a different range of interests who like the idea of this group may want to create meetups that reflect their interests.

Technically this group is limited to discussion of articles, but in reality it should allow discussing any topic that may interest you because over years your favorite newspapers and magazines most likely have had an article on anything you can ever think of.

Periodicals do have online forums, but they are a poor ersatz for a conversation in person and a poor tool for selecting people to talk to (before joining this meetup you will be offered a few questions to determine if the group matches your interests). Unfortunately there are no gathering places for those who want to meet people to discuss works of journalism. This group is designed to serve a role of such place.

Basics on how the group will operate
1. The leader will select an article (or a few) for a discussion using recommendations of the group and his own findings and post the selection approximately two weeks before a meeting. In addition to discussing articles we may want to share tips about articles and books that we find interesting.
2. We will restrict freedom of speech by a 2-3 min. limit per person per comment except instances when the group wants to hear more. Taking numbers might be another good idea.
3. Initial plan is to meet once a month – most likely we will be meeting on Mondays.
4. Meetings will be held in Manhattan.

Sample articles
List of abbreviations:
NYT - New Your Times
WSJ – Wall Street Journal
FT – Financial Times

0. The Truth About Our Libertarian Age By Mark Lilla - newrepublic.com June 17, 2014
1. The Slow Lane - It really is good to talk By Harry Eyres - FT, June 08, 2013
2. The Slow Lane - Peaks and Promenades By Harry Eyres - FT, September 05, 2014
3. The Slow Lane - Lessons in love from the ancients By Harry Eyres - FT, January 10, 2014
4. Daniel Bell (1919–2011) APRIL 7, 2011 Mark Lilla at nybooks.com
5. No Faith in Progress - Jonathan Franzen’s ‘Kraus Project’ - NYT Book Review, October 11, 2013
6. The Story Of a Lifetime; An ordinary German--and compulsive diarist--lives through Weimar, the Nazi era and the Cold War - WSJ, March 17, 2011
7. The Dangers of Certainty - A Lesson From Auschwitz By SIMON CRITCHLEY NYT (The Stone opinion series) February 2, 2014
8. I'm With Stupide - 'Bouvard and Pécuchet,' by Gustave Flaubert - NYT Book Review, January 22, 2006
9. The Examined Life By JONATHAN LEAR - NYT, October 25, 1998
10. Net wisdom - FT, February, 16, 2013
11. Lost and Found - Left in Nepal at 3, Daja Takes Decades To Find Out Why; After Being Raised by Monks, He Makes His Way to U.S.; 'Mother Where Are You'; A Leap From a Window Ledge - WSJ, March 15, 2005
12. Leo Strauss: The European By Mark Lilla, The New York Review of Books, Oct 21, 2004
13. Neocon or Not – Review of 'Reading Leo Strauss,' by Steven Smith – NYT Book review, June 25, 2006
14. “Salvation at the Forum” (The first Robert Bresson’s retrospective in this country in 14 years) – WSJ, January 5, 2012
15. The Crisis of American Self-Government; Harvey Mansfield on the 2012 election, and the real cost of entitlements - WSJ, December 1, 2012
16. Stoppard in Moscow - moreintelligentlife.com, November 26, 2007
17. Don't be an idiot. Read newspapers. BY TUNKU VARADARAJAN - OpinionJournal.com, April 30, 2002
18. Bad News - By RICHARD A. POSNER – NYT, July 31, 2007
19. "The Meaningfulness of Lives" – NYT (The Stone opinion series) September 11, 2011
20. Happiness, Beyond the Data By Gary Gutting - NYT (The Stone opinion series) April 10, 2013
21. When Socrates Met Phaedrus/ Eros in Philosophy - NYT (The Stone opinion series) November 3, 2013
22. "The Education of an Iranian Revolutionary" - Interview with Shirin Ebadi (Borrowing language from The Good Soldier Švejk this is another evidence that all great revolutions in history of humankind are worth shit) – WSJ, April 4, 2011
23. An Iranian Storyteller’s Personal Revolution – NYT, July 1, 2012
24. Prole Models by Charles Murray – WSJ, February 6, 2001
25. Bookshelf - The Imperialists and Their Attributes - THE RULING CASTE By David Gilmour – WSJ, February 23, 2006
26. Ian Smith, Defiant Symbol of White Rule in Africa, Is Dead at 88 – NYT, November 21
27. Merely Departed - Obits at This School Aren't to Die For; Dead King's College Alumni Can Expect a Roasting; 'Smut for its Own Sake' – WSJ, October 31, 2005
28. Notable & Quotable - Joseph Schumpeter writing about ‘the intellectual's righteous indignation about the wrongs of capitalism’ (‘Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy’) – WSJ, October 29, 2012
29. Herta Muller’s Literature, Born of Isolation – NYT, May 18, 2012
30. Why Won't They Listen? – review of The Righteous Mind by Jonathan Haidt - NYT, March 3, 2012
results.name: Conversations around timeless articles from weekliesNdailies

results.description:
The purpose of this group is share resources and practices so that we can nurture ourselves so that we have the joy and strength we need to live courageously, and so nurture others and the earth.  The group is led by LoraKim Joyner, wildlife veterinarian and minister (that's me).  My goal is to grow our numbers and commitment so that we can derive pleasure and joy from this beautiful earth, and so care for what we may, while we can. Other people and species need us to be as whole and as powerful as we can. The Conservationist Way is one pathway for this deep living and giving.  When we meet, I will facilitate specific practices and discussions to nurture ourselves so that we can nourish all of nature.

Please join if you wish to live more strongly connected to life around you, and if you wish to do something for others, such as addressing climate change, loss of biodiversity, extinction, or poverty.  If you arent' sure what you can do with limits on your energy, time and resources, do not hestiate and come join us. There are so many ways to preserve beauty on this earth, even in your daily routine.  

Everyone is welcome, because the earth needs us to be conservationists.

What is a conservationist?  It is you, or can be, for.....

A conservationist is one who increases knowledge and awareness of nature, and uses that understanding to save themselves and the world.

To find out more, go here.

Let us join one another so that our experiences and compassion can guide the way on the path of conservation and joy.
results.name: The Conservationist's Way: A Nurture Nature Group

results.description:
Do you like to dance? Are you interested in Scottish or Celtic music and culture? Would you like to meet great people, get some exercise, and have fun? Then come dance with us! Beginners are welcome; you don't need to bring a partner; you don't need any special costume, just soft-soled shoes with no heels and clean soles (to keep the dance floor clean -- you can change into them when you arrive).

Scottish country dancing is a social dance form where you dance with a partner in a set of couples, somewhat like square dancing or contra dancing. In each dance you will do a set of patterns using skipping steps, which are taught and practiced during the weekly classes. There are several dance parties throughout the year, as well as more formal balls in which dancers from all across the region come together and dance to live music. Each session has a break for tea and snacks during which you can rest and socialize. The dancers are very friendly and will always help you out if you get confused or forget what to do next.

Here's an example of what it looks like (and another).
results.name: Westchester Scottish Country Dance Society

results.description:
Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York

This group is for Aisans, people interested in Asian culture professionally and those interested in Asian languages.


The age of this groups members is 20-40.

The group meets in Westchester, New York and occassionally in Manhattanb, New York.  We are going to have events in all major Westchester cities.  This includes;  White Plains, Yonkers, and Tarrytown.

Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York has activities for singles and families.  If an activity is for families it says (FAMILY ACTIVITY) on posting.

This is a meetup group for people in Westchester County, New York that are interested in Asian Culture and activities that are typically Asian.  Asian Culture of Westchester, New York is a New York group about Asian community and studies.  We engage in monthly activities, the majority of which are in White Plains, New York.  We do have activities planned at other Westchester, New York locations.    At least 3 times a year we are going to have an activity in Manhattan, New York.  The activities of the group are either based on Asian culture or are social events exclusively for people interested in Asian culture.  

You need to apply for membership into this group. This is to keep out unwanted people.  We do not want people joining this group simply to meet foreign women, or who are not deeply into Asian culture, but seek meager entertainment.  This group is for people who are members of the Asian community.  You do not have to be Asian to join this group.  This is a group for people who are seriously interested in Asian culture and Asians!  We do no permit people who are voyeurs or who do not take the groups subject matter seriously.  Please do not let this discourage you.  This is a security measure to allow us to have a high quality and more productive group.


The activities of this group include:

Asian Bar Nights

Asian Nightclub Nights

Asian Social Networking Events

Asian History Discussions

Asian Religious Discussions

Chinese New Year Celebrations

The Spring Blossom Festival

Kabuki Theatre

Karaoke

Asian Movie Viewing Nights

Visiting Koreatown.

Visiting Flushings Chinatown

Visiting Manhattan's Chinatown and Canal Street.

Visiting Manhattan, New York fir Asian culture events.

Visiting Buddhist Temples and Shrines

Lectures on Asian Culture

Asian Language Exchanges

The group meets every month.

Tet Celebration

The group is lead by a native New Yorker, who is a Buddhist/Taoist instructor and martial arts teacher.  The organizer is also an active member of the Asian community in; New York and Hawaii.  The organizer enjoys; Asian clubs in New York, karaoke, surfing, and the arts.


Thank you,

Erik

The Asian Culture in Westchester New York Meetup Organizer
results.name: Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York Meetup

results.description:
(best viewed in desktop version).

A sketch group for nudist male artists where artists take turns posing for each other. Our focus is to draw the male figure and depict masculinity in an open-minded, sex-positive nature not found in traditional drawing groups. When both the model and the artist are naked, they are on equal footing, encouraging openness and camaraderie. Sex or touching is not allowed except as part of a pose; some of which are homoerotic; please read the rules and FAQ below. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CRITERIA TO JOIN THIS GROUP:

• individuals who present themselves with primarily masculine or male features, including transgendered men

• visual artist (mandatory, any level from beginner to experienced), all non-smelly mediums except photography. Since we pose for each other, we don't accept guys who only want to pose. 

• comfortable being nude with fellow artists, willing to pose naked for other artists

• friendly, respectful

• photo in profile (headshot/face preferred)

• be local or have plans to travel to NYC

(NEW) Young members (18-29) get a discount on most event fees.

First-time artists must sign a form allowing (or not allowing) us to photograph their artwork done during the session and publish on the group’s sites and social media. We generally post artwork only without any identification. It's okay to decline but still fill out a form. If you decline, don’t put your drawings out for the photographer.

First-time artists are encouraged but not required to pose.

(Scroll down for additional info)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STANDARD RULES:

The rules are the same whether in a studio or a private home. Any variations will be announced. This is a drawing group that explores sex-positive poses of the male figure, often including homoerotic poses.

No photography of people without permission.

No sexual activity anywhere in the building, other than as part of a pose.

When you’re not posing, erections are natural and okay but stroking is not.

RULES ABOUT POSES

If you don’t want touching of any kind, tell your partner or do a solo pose.

Plan your pose before getting on the model stand.

Erotic/sexual poses are totally optional. If you do a sexual pose, talk it through with your partner. Poses are not an excuse to have sex with an unwilling partner. Don’t assume. It’s always okay to say no or stop. If you don’t have CLEAR consent, don’t get sexual.

A little movement is okay, but come back to the same position and hold it. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PRIORITY RSVP AND "NO-SHOW" POLICY:

To reward regular attendance and reduce “no-shows”, we have a priority RSVP system similar to airline priority seating. To attend a session, everyone must first join the waitlist. RSVPs will be confirmed by group (Goldstar, Fan, NewlyJoined all). http://www.meetup.com/Mens-Naked-Drawing-Group-NY/pages/Priority_RSVP_and_no-show_policy

VOLUNTEER ROLES (this is a group effort):

• Bring healthy snacks/refreshments to share (optional).

• Photographing artwork. (NEW): Session Art Photographer positions available

• Music (bring your device, i.e. iPod, etc.)

• Thinking of interesting poses – all artists

• Setting up and cleaning up

ADDITIONAL INFO:

We meet 3-8 times per month, on various Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. Please check the schedule.

Multiple locations. Address given to members only.

RSVP via Meetup only.

Regular session fee: $15 cash. Credit cards accepted for advance payment. Use the link in the event description. (NEW) YOUNG MEMBERS fee is $10 cash. Special sessions may have a higher fee.

Arrive 15-30 minutes before event start time. Everyone sets up. 

Overall session time is 3 hours. It’s a 2-1/2 hour drawing session with a little social time before and breaks during.  Everyone cleans up after.

BRING ALL YOUR OWN MATERIALS, drawing boards, portable easels, etc. Most guys draw on pads on their laps. There is a sink available for rinsing your brushes.

Bring a towel or sit on your shirt. Please be hygienic.

Be mindful of your stuff (wallet, phone, etc). MNDGNY or the venues are not responsible for lost or stolen items.

Full nudity of all participants is required for the duration of the session. Tuesday venue: footwear is recommended when not on the model stand.

Each artist should think about his possible poses in advance while the other artists should offer friendly suggestions. 

Please put out some of your drawings so others can see them. If you’re working in a notebook, show your drawings to the person taking photographs so he can take some snapshots. TAKE YOUR DRAWINGS HOME WITH YOU!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

I DON'T KNOW HOW TO DRAW; IS THERE ANY INSTRUCTION? At regular sessions, there is no instruction, but beginner artists are welcome to try us out as long as you have the interest and make the effort to draw. From time to time, there will be special classes with instruction from a naked teacher; please check the schedule.

I'VE NEVER BEEN TO A NAKED EVENT BEFORE. WHAT'S IT LIKE? We're a friendly bunch and nonjudgmental. We have a wide range of ages and body types. At studio venues, there are usually about 15-20 artists, at private homes about 10 artists. Everyone gets fully undressed after checking in and stays naked for the entire session. It's quite natural and relaxed. However, unlike a typical, strictly non-sexual naturist activity, the poses can be sexual.

I'VE NEVER POSED BEFORE. Many of our members had never posed before joining our group. We'll help you out if you want, so no need to stress out about it. It might be easier to pose together with someone else to start. There is a sign-up sheet for poses with about 12-15 posing slots per session (varying lengths 5-20 minutes) so not everyone poses at each session. First-timers are not required to pose. Poses are up to each artist posing. They can be classical, athletic, dance-like, sexy, etc. Erotic poses are welcome but not required. 

IS THIS A GAY GROUP? Many of our members are gay, but we are open to men regardless of sexual orientation. In fact, we don't talk about it much. However, some artists create poses that are homoerotic/sexual so you should be comfortable with that.

WHAT'S THE SEXUAL ENERGY OF THE GROUP LIKE? The sexual energy level varies depending on who shows up and is often higher at private homes but the focus is always on the art. This is not a hook-up event.

WHAT IF I GET AN ERECTION? Erections are natural and are welcome. However, when you're socializing or supposed to be drawing, masturbating is not okay.

WHO KEEPS THE DRAWINGS THAT I POSED FOR? Each artist keeps his own drawings. The model can ask for/trade/buy other artists' drawings.

Organized by Shungaboy

Our social media:

Our Website: http://mndgny.com...

Our Twitter: https://twitter.com/M...

Our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook....

Our Wordpress Blog: http://mndgny.wordpre...

Updated 3/12/2016

results.description:
When the schedule says a start time it doesn't mean you have to be there at the specified start time. you can arrange to come at any point from start time to 8 pm. Saturday & Sunday activities are available all day long not just starting at 9 am. Just say you will be attending for the day and tell me what time you plan to show up than watch for my confirmation reply. If you have my text # already you can contact me via text as well but please if you can also show attendance on this site if you can't I totally understand it can get tedious signing in at this site for every class. I've experienced it myself attending other people's meetups. I'm Rob by name. Adrenalhigh Rob or Sergeant Pain if you prefer. :-) Now for the information about this training.

This group will include outdoor martial arts training and outdoor social sports in NYC & BK as well as indoor martial arts training on rainy and cold days in Brooklyn.

All training and sports will be on a first request basis. Whomever requests whichever activity on any given day / time is what we will do.

Tennis & Paddle Ball 

For tennis I will bring 100 balls and we will do drills first than play a game than review our weaknesses and drill our weaknesses. There will be no charge for this unless you need to borrow a racquet than it will be a $5 charge for racquet rental.

Social & Competitive Volleyball & Badminton:
Coming soon

Martial Arts:

Though martial arts classes show starting at a specific time you can arrive at any time from the start time to as late as 8 pm. Just let me know what time you plan to arrive. However, it's always preferred you come at the beginning of a session.

I've been doing Martial Arts since very young and am over 40 now. We will cover the following.

Wing Chun

Muay Thai

BJJ-Brazilian Jiu Jitsu

Hung Ga

Choy Lay Fut

Philippine Stick Fighting

Traditional European Fencing-Not Olympic style but the style used to actually fight / defend yourself.

Chinese Broad Sword

Japanese Sword

Traditional European Fencing

Pole

Spear

Chain Whip

Chi Gung

Tai Chi

Heavy Weapons from SCA / Rennaissance.

This is no joke. I've been doing all of these and more for at least 4 years each up to 20 years for some. Each class will be only $5 for up to 4 hours of training a day. For training in NYC you'll need to bring your own gear if you come to Brooklyn you can use my gear. Please bring the exact amount I won't always have change.

Why am I doing this?

Just to keep my skills sharp. So come and get it if you like a challenge and becoming fit and skilled. Some training will be outdoors on favorable weather days . Otherwise I have a heated garage we will use. I have every weapon you can possibly imagine we'll be using, A Muk Jong / Wooden man and full body protection for at least two people so starting out. As well as kettle bells, lat pull down system, flexibility training devices, elastic bands & iron body conditioning systems. For the colder times of the year come dressed for chilly but not cold temperature and on day 1 you'll see what you will need or may want to get in the future. 

What we train in for the day will be based on who makes the initial training request and a majority preference. 

Don't worry I've done this before and it works out well. 

Before your first class please send me a direct email that you want to attend and what time and where.  For the winter all training will be in Brooklyn, Bensonhurst, D Train to 18th Ave. In the summer trainings will occur either in BK or NYC based on individual request.

On day 1 we'll have to arrange the meeting time so I can come get you. After day 1 you'll be able to come at any point. 

NOTE WHEN I DID THIS BEFORE THERE ARE ALWAYS PEOPLE WHO SAY THEY ARE COMING BUT DON"T SHOW UP. NO SHOWS WITHOUT NOTIFICATION WILL NOT BE ABLE TO CONTINUE. I OFFER A THREE STRIKE POLICY

The mission of New Jersey Screenwriters is to provide formal tools to established and aspiring screenwriters alike while also fostering a sense of community and mutual learning that engenders friendship, fellowship and the potential to create marketable products. This community provides opportunities for writers to acquire or hone a variety of skills, from character development, structure and formatting to pitching. Peer to peer feedback will be a routine aspect of each meeting along with career guidance from industry professionals. Affording opportunities to network both personally and professionally is a foundation of this organization. This is accomplished through the following types of monthly events: - Writing Workshops: We bring in industry professionals for hands-on sessions where you can learn new techniques and skills to improve your work. - Feedback Opportunities and Pitching Practice: You will have many opportunities to present in front of your peers in order to gain exposure and gather feedback. - Networking Events: Meet other writers, actors, directors, producers, and other industry professionals to explore and form new collaborations. - Film Screenings: We curate films based on the group's interest to stimulate and facilitate group discussion and learning. - Guest Speaker Series: We invite active industry professionals who will share their experiences, insights, and advice. The programming of this group and the nature of the support will grow and align with the needs of New Jersey Screenwriters (NJS) members.


Keep up with us in our Google Community: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104069023001226753586

results.description:
CCNYC is the local chapter of Conscious Capitalism, a national organization rooted in the principles of Conscious Capitalism as described by John Mackey and Raj Sisodia in their seminal book.

The commitment to create a Conscious Capitalism Chapter in one of the world’s global financial centers presents a unique opportunity. Those of us spearheading the effort have felt a great sense of responsibility to create an organization that not only reflects the character and commerce of this city, but also supports the tenets of Conscious Capitalism in a place that unquestionably has tremendous influence over the way capitalism is practiced in the world today. As we move forward, we want to acknowledge the special circumstances and enormous opportunities inherent in building a chapter so close to Wall Street. And so, we’ve come to the conclusion as a group that our chapter must be as inclusive as this city, and also as driven.

We believe Conscious Capitalism is a new paradigm for operating corporations; one that recognizes the power of capitalism to improve the human condition and create enduring value for all stakeholders. We invite anyone who is curious about these ideas and those who already embrace them to join us as we reach high and strive to create change in our society.
results.name: Conscious Capitalism NYC

results.description:
“A mystical approach to Judaism is…less dogmatic and more experimental. It doesn’t have a low ceiling, capping the mind and frustrating its desire to unify in love and awe with a vital, living universe. It is open minded, open souled. It says, ‘Try this. If you feel it as a living reality, we’re getting somewhere.’” 

Reb Zalman Schachter-Shalomi zt”l 

This is an incredibly exciting time to be Jewish! As the paradigms shift, it is becoming increasingly clear that much of Judaism is rapidly evolving into a community more attuned to the inner life and focused on awakening, that is, the expansion of consciousness. 

Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken! A Community of Spiritual Seekers (for Jews and Non-Jews), now emerging in Flatbush (Brooklyn), is a part of this exciting transition, and we invite you into our experimental boat! 

Come chant, dance, drum, and meditate with us! Grab an oar! 

But first, email us, so we can have a cup of tea together! 

May your Light increase! 

Stay blessed and be well.
results.name: Uri! Uri! Awaken! Awaken!

results.description:
Life in New York is fun but it does take a toll on us. We are always in a rush, always in transition. By the weekend or a day off, we are exhausted and don't even feel that accomplished. In all this vanity, we hardly spend any time with our friends, people we could open ours souls to. We almost never have time or possibility to sit down with a trusted friend and open up about our thoughts and feelings. We push it all down in a constant chase for New York life. No wonder, we get burned out, we loose touch with who we are. Then we make mistakes in our choices when it comes to careers and relationships. We get lost. 
So my dear Goddess we need to find time to create that safe place where we could come together, release our concerns and worries, open our hearts and souls, and connect with our femininity. Let's find the power in sisterhood, and empower each other by connecting and sharing our minds, hearts and souls. Let's create judgment free space to harbor our femininity and empower each other to live in this crazy and amazing city.
results.name: New York Women's Empowerment Meetup

MEMBERS PLEASE NOTE:  DUE TO LOW SUMMER TURNOUT THE GROUP WILL BE TEMPORARILY CLOSED DOWN UNTIL APPROXIMATELY MID-SEPTEMBER AND THEN WILL START UP AGAIN.

Do you love movies? Do you love the awesome reclining seats at the AMC 84th Street theater on Broadway? Do you love being able to reserve seats ahead of time? Then this is the group for you. When there are films at that theater that are appropriate for the group, we'll go there. Please note that you are always personally responsible for buying your own ticket; the organizer will let the group know when she buys her ticket and will provide her seat number should you wish to sit with the group.

Sometimes, we will see films at other theaters. Your organizer will mostly keep meetups to midtown west or the upper west side (off of the "A" or "1" train lines). Following the films, we'll go out for dinner or drinks in nearby restaurants. Sometimes we'll go cheap and other times, we'll treat ourselves to a nice dinner. This is a meetup for those who love to treat themselves to dinner and a movie and find the upper west side most convenient. 

Always, always, always buy your own ticket unless the event description says otherwise (Ali gets questions about this very single event so please read . . .  YOU BUY YOUR OWN TICKET!!!). Hopefully everyone will see and read this. :-)

I look forward to meeting you all.

Ali

P.S. Please go to the "Files" link (click on "More" and then "Files") and download a copy of the group rules so that you are familiar with how the group is run.

results.description:
This Meetup is an ongoing user group of technology and business professionals who are experiencing challenges with getting the necessary internet connectivity to support their businesses and operations here in ALL parts of the Five Boroughs.


Whether it be a simple cable connection or a Gig-E Fiber build out, this is a user (customer) based forum to communicate with one other on your challenges and needs for better connectivity. This Meetup will have a monthly meeting on the first Thursday of every month at the Midtown HQ of our founding sponsor (with cocktails to follow!) where we will invite a variety of specialists from different ISPs available here in NYC and other industry experts to listen to our needs and then hopefully build solutions for our members.

Membership is restricted to consumers of commercial internet connectivity ONLY with representatives from ISPs being allowed to sponsor and present their wares in a fair and organized fashion.

Even if you think you are in the farthest reaches of NYC and you're stuck with your DSL from 1999, join up and by working together we will help you catch up to the 21st Century!
results.name: CONNECTIVITY CHALLENGED IN NYC

results.description:
This is NOT a group for people looking to start a business or MLMers or those who just want to "join" a Meetup group.   This is NOT a networking or referral organization (that's what BNI is for).  You must be an owner or partner in an actual business (online or offline) to participate.

Are you ready for an organization that's only for business owners and is focused on helping you work "ON" your business rather than just "IN" your business? Do you want to get better, bottom-line results for your business, with the help of some of the top business people in New York, while also having fun? Whether you are a sole proprietor or have 2-150 employees, Level Up Your Business is for you!

Created by bestselling author, speaker and entrepreneur, Tim Houston, Level Up members are small business owners and entrepreneurs from a variety of different industries and ofline professions -- both online and offline -- who appreciate the ability to share ideas, solve problems and identify opportunities for one another, all with the goals of becoming more productive, profitable and prosperous!

We are a membership-based organization. Because we limit each of our local groups to a maximum of 20 business owners, our monthly meetings are fun, very interactive, positive, and strictly confidential, all with a focus on getting bottom line results for our members. At each session, we have a world-class workshop focusing on business development and a time for each of the members to share the challenges & successes they are having in their own businesses.

Membership information is given at the actual meeting but you can try Level Up Your Business by registering for as a guest one of our upcoming monthly sessions. For more information and newly forming groups, visit www.levelupyourbusiness.com
results.name: Level Up Your Business

The MOMS Club® Of Ramsey is a chapter of MOMS Club® International (www.momsclub.org). MOMS Offering Moms Support®

We accept members from Ramsey and the surrounding towns.

We are a support group designed just for you, the at-home mother! You are interested in the world around you, want a variety of activities for you and your children, and are proud of your choice of at-home mothering for your families!

Being a MOMS Club® member entitles you to a monthly calendar of events that includes:

♦ Age Appropriate Playgroups ♦ Open Playgroups ♦ Playground & Park Outings ♦ Craft Activities ♦ Grocery & Restaurant tours ♦ Seasonal Parties ♦ Field Trips ♦ Stroller Walks ♦ Meals provided for members with newborns ♦ MOMS Night Out ♦ Book Club And Much More!!

results.description:
Music make you lose control? Dance Walk is calling! Bring your iPod & headphones--everybody listens to their own music, as we dance walk around the Prospect Park loop. What is "dance walking"? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. 

For inspiration, check out: www.24hoursofhappy.com

Here's a funny and smart article recently published about the Dance Walk in Prospect Park:

http://themomtropolis.com/dance-walk-you-know-you-want-to/
results.name: Prospect Park, Brooklyn--Dance Walk

results.description:
If you write and enjoy being around others who are obsessed/possessed by words, this is the group for you. We're poets, fantasy writers, bloggers, ghost writers and everything in between. We're all on a mission to create and inspire. Some are published, some are not, most are trying to finish a project and others just want to get back in the habit of writing. Some of us write for a living, many don't. We are all working towards a creative goal and all are welcome! <br>

Each session centers on a specific topic. We discuss and write on that topic through different prompts and activities. We allow our members to choose. Project discussion is limited to under 10 minutes, depending on how many people sign up and participate. We have a website, where group members will be able to post projects for group comments. Check out http://www.nywritingclub.com.

We meet every two weeks, usually at the same location. We also meet at coffee shops or go out for drinks as well. To get a good feel for who we are and what we're about, read a description of one of our past meetups.

If you appreciate writing and expressing yourself, why not come share it with others Let's gain inspiration and inspire each other at the same time!

"Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions." --Paulo Coelho

<br>

<br>

Are you born again or desire to be according to John 3:5-7, have you been baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of your sins and been filled with the Holy Ghost as the disciples were as recorded in the book of Acts? (Acts 2:4,38-39) Do you love the name of Jesus Christ above all other names (Acts 4:12) and love to talk about what Jesus Christ has done for you in your life? If so, join us as we get together to exhort, strengthen and encourage one another in the faith.

results.description:
Our intention is to bring together people at the nexus of consciousness-raising, social entrepreneurship and social change to network and to spotlight individuals, projects, movements, NGO's, and for-good companies that are extending love and creativity into the world in ways that inspire others to do the same. 

We will attempt to bring a spiritual perspective to themes such as environmentalism, sustainability, human rights, economic justice and women's empowerment. From the point of view of spirit, "nothing real can be threatened" [A Course in Miracles]. From this perspective, it is madness to try to change anyone or anything; however, this conclusion hardly precludes action! Once freed from the need to change ourselves or others, we can devote all our thoughts to sharing our love and creativity, and there are an infinite variety of ways we can be kind and helpful to one another. In fact, it is only through sharing our inner creativity and unconditional love that we remember and realize our limitlessness.

To this end we envision hosting documentary film screenings, mixers, lectures, fundraisers, panel discussions, Q&As, and, perhaps later, organizing and/or participating in various social good projects. We value diversity and inclusivity  and invite you to share your voice with the community.
results.name: Spirituality & Social Change Meetup

"Alone we beg. Together we make demands."

results.description:
After joining multiple Meetups and meeting people in everyday situations, I have confirmed that the life of an Introvert isn't easy. For those of us who are outgoing, we may attract those who don't quite understand us, leaving them feeling like we are not interested in establishing (or maintaining) friendships, or that we dislike people. This is normally not the truth for most Introverts. Many of us desire and want meaningful friendships but our dominant need to be in our own, undisrupted thoughts sometimes get in the way.

This Meetup is for Introverts (and those who can or want to understand us) who want to meet new people (and possibly establish some meaningful friendships), mingle, and partake in social activities.

Free Myers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) Test: http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/jtypes2.asp

results.description:
The Challenge

You’re expecting twins or your twins are 0-6months! You have a million questions and you don’t know where to start. Plus you have no idea who to talk to. You need some answers and you need a support system to get you through it.

The Solution

Twin Love Concierge’s New York & Connecticut Expecting Twins Classes, Postnatal services and Twins & Sleep classes help connect you with other twin parents in your local area while answering all of the twin questions you would like answered. We combining the two essentials all new twin parents need – support and experience. Our twin experts educate you on all the key topics surrounding twin parenthood and allow you to enjoy the babies and not feel overwhelmed.

The classes span Manhattan, Brooklyn, Westchester, Greenwich and Long Island.

For full details on topics we cover, locations, times and the most up to date twin information see - www.twinloveconcierge.com

results.description: Have a really bright kid with learning and/or social challenges? Twice exceptionally gifted kids may experience school-based issues, difficulty finding and forming meaningful peer relationships and managing challenges at home. Parents' needs are often as unique as their children's in finding solutions for school and home related issues, and finding an understanding peer group to share strengths and struggles with in a safe and nonjudgmental environment. As a consultant, licensed clinical therapist, and the parent of a young adult who is gifted and has struggled in traditional school settings, I am hosting monthly gatherings for parents of twice exceptionally gifted children and adolescents. If you think that you have a twice exceptional child, but aren't sure, feel free to contact me.

results.description:
Hello and welcome to Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special. 

When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of an hour or two. Once you've met everyone, we usually get food and/or drinks somewhere. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face.

Some of my more popular and repeating Date Walks are: 

► Big Group Brooklyn Bridge Sunset Singles Walk
► Big Group Central Park Singles Stroll
► Big Group Singles 3-Bridge Walk
► Big Group Singles Roosevelt Island Walk
► Big Group Singles Stroll around Astoria
► Big Group Singles Sunset Walk on the High Line
► Big Group Date Walk for Dog Lovers  

If you have any questions, comments, concerns or ideas, please do not hesitate to get in touch. 

Thank you,
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer
 
Call/Text: 347-225-3516
Email: datewalking@gmail.com

Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter 


I've tried Plenty of Fish, OKcupid, Coffee meets Bagel, Craigslist, Tinder and so on and it's the same thing every time: a little bit of back-and-forth communication that eventually diminishes to nothing. Either that or you actually meet a person here and a person there and there's no chemistry so it's over. More wasted time. I've been hosting walking events on Meetup groups for over 3 years and as far as I'm concerned, it's the best way to meet a woman because you're not just meeting 1 woman. It's like going on a date with 10 to 50 women at once and you get to walk and talk to them all. The only problem with regular walking groups is that you don't know who's single and who' isn't. With Date Walking you know.
results.name: Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special

topics.name: Running: Beginning Train for a Marathon

results.description:
This group is for everyone who enjoys running, outdoor activity, traveling, meeting new people, and most importantly who's getting ready for Paris 2015 Marathon.
If you are planning to run Paris 2015 Marathon and want to meet others, who are planning to do the same, please join the group and let's get ready for this wonderful event together.
results.name: New York Marathon Meetup for Paris 39th 2015 Marathon

results.description:
Brooklyn Breathwork is a monthly gathering that honors the sacred gift of life through the gentle and transformative modality of rebirthing breathwork. We also host special evenings with lightworkers and healers. We are here to create a conscious, sacred and supportive community in the heart of one of the greatest cities in the world. Breathe on with love! Unless otherwise noted, every group breathe and Brooklyn Breathwork event costs $25.

Rebirthing Breathwork, also commonly referred to as rebirthing or conscious connected breathing, is an acceleration of the healing process through an exploration and practice of the breath. Bypassing the mind entirely, the rebirthing breath goes deep into your cells, saturating the body with both oxygen and life force, and helps to release any negative self-thought, perceived limitations, past trauma or any uncomfortable feelings that are held in the body. It is a truly transformational modality that helps the breather recognize their union with their higher self and all of life with peace and absolute love.
results.name: Brooklyn Breathwork

results.description:
Our Meetup Purpose: This is a group for mature Myers-Briggs "iNtuitive Feelers" (NF) who want to meet other intuitive feelers for deeper and more intimate conversations and connections.  Approximately one in ten people fit the NF personality profile.  If you are not sure if you fit the profile, click "Pages" up above, and click on the free test link to take a personality test.  

Our group of NFs will favor positive, uplifting, and inspiring conversations amongst those of us over 30 years old.  It will be a supportive environment where we can learn and grow. I believe that we "idealists" have the most amazing potential to do good in our society. Let's SUPPORT one another in our dreams, our goals, and investing our amazing potential back into our families, our society, and in our world!


What Wikipedia says about us:  "As the identity-seeking temperament, Idealists long for meaningful communication and relationships. They search for profound truths hidden beneath the surface, often expressing themselves in metaphor. Focused on the future, they are enthusiastic about possibilities, and they continually strive for self-renewal and personal growth.

Idealists strive to discover who they are and how they can become their best possible self -- always this quest for self-knowledge and self-improvement drives their imagination - and Idealists yearn to help others make the journey too."
results.name: NYC Idealists - NF (INFP, INFJ, ENFP, ENFJ) meetup (Age 30+)

topics.name: Free or Cheap Stuff to Do

results.description: Learn, practice, improve, and enjoy dancing Argentine tango at these two weekly practicas. Rebecca, an expert in the field, dancing tango 24 years now, will spend time with any dancer wanting some help on the dance floor. This is a great bargain because each practica costs $12/person and you're getting a mini-private-lesson and lots of nice people to practice with, snacks, great music, beautiful dance floor. Racing Club Practica meets every Thursday 9 pm to 12:00 am and Rawson Practica meets every Saturday 2 to 5 pm at Stepping Out Studios, 37 W 26th Street, 9th floor. Rebecca also offers a full program of classes and lessons, and you can read more about those at rebeccatango.com. But this Meetup group is all about practicing at whatever skill level you are currently enjoying, and getting ready to go out to milongas and simply dance, express the music, connect with a partner, and have some intense fun!
results.name: New York Tango Practica Meetup - Rebecca Hosts

results.description: Hello fellow ASMR people. We may watch/make ASMR (Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response) videos alone, but that doesn't mean we shouldn't get together and talk about ASMR. Everyone is welcome, even if you don't experience ASMR! We'll meet to discuss this "phenomenon" and how it relates to relaxation, tingles, sleep, anxiety, depression, scientific research, current culture, internet trends, and anything else you'd like to talk about. I started this group to meet others who are interested in ASMR on any level. We will have in-depth conversations, share stories, knowledge and tips, and enjoy each other's company in a relaxed setting.
results.name: New York ASMR Group

results.description:
Whether it's finding a job you love, fixing your relationship, losing 30 pounds or simply being ready for the next exciting chapter in life, the work you do at HG provides immediate inspiration, serious results and lasting knowledge.

Our Life Coaches utilize the Handel Method, which is also the foundation of the work we do in companies such as BASF, The New York Times and Vogue as well as the classes we teach at MIT, NYU and Stanford.

Together we dig deep, play big and don’t stop until goals are fulfilled and lessons learned. We care, we love what we do and we walk our talk.


The Handel Method®

The Handel Method® was created by Handel Group® co-founder Lauren Zander over the past 15 years. The method is the foundation for courses we teach at institutions such as MIT, NYU and Stanford, the work we do within companies such as AOL, BASF, Sony, BP, and The New York Times, and the coaching that we provide to individuals. The method is revolutionary yet easy to understand, methodical yet customizable. The Handel Method® is based on a belief in the power of speaking the truth, and in Personal Integrity® as the most direct avenue toward creating permanent change in any area of life. We work with clients to address their fears, thoughts, and negative beliefs so that they are free to invent a life they love.


For more information on the Handel Group, please visit

http://handelgroup.com
results.name: Handel Group Life Coaches

results.description:
Hey All! 


I host poker games in Kearny, or sometimes at a location near the Newark bridge in Harrison, NJ. Right now we play $1-2 No Limit Hold'em with the ocassional rotation of $1-2 Pot Limit Omaha IF NO ONE OBJECTS. This means if you are uncomfortable playing Omaha, then the crew is okay with playing Texas all night. Depending on the location, I will either be using my custom-made full sized 10 handed poker table or a smaller 9 max table. 


What is guaranteed are: comfy chairs, custom ceramic chips and Gemaco cards. Drinks/Snacks are always provided, and occasionally we will have catered food . The game for the most part is full of mid 20 year old players. This game started off as a 25-50 cent game a few years ago that evolved over the years into a full ring $1-2 game. If you want to join us EMAIL me with your NAME and PHONE# 


Text/Call (973) 771-6775 or NJPokerMadness@gmail.com for more information!

topics.name: Practicing the early stages of Argentine Tango

results.description:
Welcome at Ultimate Tango!

Here you find all you need to become a true member of Tango community. We focus on developing in you the truth understanding of what Tango is.

Tango is not just a dance. It’s philosophy, the way of comprehending the world, the way of building relationships, the way to understand yourself.

Here at Ultimate Tango we teach you the tango alphabet, we teach you how to create words, we teach you basic rules, basic steps, basic combinations. We teach you all you need to know about music, connection, lead and follow, types of tangos and more. From there you can launch onto your own journey to discover what Tango means for you. 

We don’t want to limit you with multitude of steps and clatter your memory with combinations you can never remember. Our goal is to give you the true understanding of Tango structure and music, mechanics of the movement, technique and cadence. From there you can start improvising on you own. Find your own style.

We offer carefully structured courses in Tango, Vals and Milonga at 3 different levels – beginner, intermediate, advanced at 3 different locations: New York City NY, West New York NJ and Boston MA. We also offer workshops to address more specialized topics. Private lessons are available for those who wish to progress at their own pace.

DON'T REPEAT MINDLESSLY. LEARN THROUGH UNDERSTANDING.
results.name: Ultimate Tango NYC Meetup

results.description:
Sorry for this group being in "Private" setting.  We value members' privacy.  I'm sure you wouldn't expect anything less!  

These days in New York City, we have seen some dramatic increase in number of AM/WF couple and more AM/WF couples have placed wedding notices in New York Times. Yet, when this Meetup group was originally formed in early 2012, aside from us, there were NO Meetup that specifically supports AM/WF couple or singles who are interested in getting into AM/WF relationship. Through various activities such as brunch, dinner, movie, party,discussions or other outdoor activities, we hope this group, as a pioneer in this niche group, will aspire more people to be a part of this specific community or be open to this type of relationship.

IMPORTANT NOTE: In ongoing efforts to balance AM/WF ratio, if you are AM, there MIGHT be a wait before approval. WF will be approved rather quickly, unless we feel that she wouldn't be able to find any match in this group. This waitlist is not necessarily a first come, first serve.

Couples are welcomed, as long as they are AM/WF couple. Please reference each other when you "apply". Thanks.

results.description:
Welcome to the Central NJ chapter of Teach and Learn Networking!

Events - Community - Consulting

Entrepreneurs, business professionals, we know how you feel about networking. It sucks. Unless there's free wine involved, walking up to strangers and talking about work (after you've worked all day) sounds like torture.

Does a professional networking event have to feel like a middle school dance? No.

Teach and Learn Networking believes in curating environments where sharing ideas, resources, and network power feels natural. 

How do we do that?

Good question. Conversation and education.

You'll participate in facilitated networking activities (a fancy word for ice breakers) to get the conversation flowing with the most electric entrepreneurs, biz professionals, c-suite execs, and startups in our area. We know that honing your skill set is essential to your $uccess, so our speakers focus on teaching, not selling. 

What are people saying about us? Check out some testimonials here, or scroll back through our past events and check the comments. 

We also provide private consulting and management services for businesses looking to amplify their message with events! Contact us for more info.

Our newsletter (coming Jan 2016!) and membership to our group is free. If you’d like to sponsor, do a giveaway, or be a vendor at an upcoming event, contact Sam Popp at samanthaepopp@gmail.com

www.tandlnetworking.com
results.name: Teach + Learn Networking: CNJ Chapter

results.description:
We’ve all had the experience of feeling socially confident...sometimes it’s there, sometimes not. What is that feeling? Why do some people just have that magnetic glow? ..At times we try, but feel disconnected and don’t know why.  This group is a fun chill space to discuss these topics - as well as a place to come and hang out!   Feel free to bring a book, game, computer, or object of choice. Join a circle chat or just hang around. Our vision is to spread an atmosphere of safety that invites playful connection.  We explore topics such as: what it means to have ‘inherent belonging’, the power of play in creating safety & connection, and the energetic benefits of music.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfeBofb3bzI&list=UUi-z-bUXKT6SwIHxc6tlbrg

results.description:
Greetings Heroes,

Welcome to our official home on meetup.com! eSports Heroes is a global organization of gamers who care deeply about the growing world of electronic sports. Over the last decade, online gaming has become a staple of modern life. Thus, professional gaming has exploded in popularity and is now the fastest growing entertainment genre among young adults globally. The world of eSports is an uncharted, untapped frontier from which we can establish ourselves as early adopters.

eSports Heroes of NYC is the original ESH chapter. We are an ambitious group of like minded entrepreneurs who care deeply about the advancement of this industry and will help spearhead this movement to make eSports synonymous with sports. 

If you are interested in making new friends, forging professional relationships, and becoming part of this growing industry feel free to join. 

Currently supported games include:  Hearthstone - Starcraft 2 - Overwatch - Heroes of the Storm - Counter Strike - Call of Duty - Dota 2 - League of Legends - Super Smash Bros

Members are eligible for the following meetups: Tournaments / LAN Events - Hearthstone Fireside Gatherings - Industry Trade Shows - Meet the Pros - Pro Gaming Workshops - Impromptu Gaming Sessions  - Domestic / International Field Trips - Food & Fellowship. 

Potential ESH sponsorship are available to gamers who show exceptional skill or dedication to their craft.

If you are interested in founding your own eSports Heroes chapter we have developed the infrastructure to support you. Please fill out an application on our website: eSports Hero
results.name: eSports Heroes of NYC

results.description:
Hello cinephiles!  If you love movies, eating and talking....our meetup is for you! We have a nice group of people where everyone is friendly and no one is left out. At our events, we end up with great discussions and lots of laughs. I decided to start my own meet up after attending many that were not inclusive or friendly.  I am a movie obsessed woman living in North NJ. I adore great films and even more, sharing my opinions, hearing other's opinions and having lively discussions about movies. I would love to gather together other movie buffs to see movies in a theater and then do brunch, lunch or dinners where we talk about the film and just have fun. Everyone is welcome, the only thing you need is a love of movies, an opinion to share and a sense of humor! This meet up will take suggestions and opinions for movies and places to eat. I would say if you live in North NJ in Bergen, Essex or Hudson County that would be convenient. See you at the movies!

Note: I appreciate yearly dues of $5.00 which are given to me at first meetup.

If you RSVP and do not show up and do not notify us, you will be removed. Sometimes we have reservations so we need an accurate head count. Also, please let us know if you cannot come so we don't end up waiting for you at the theater.

Looking forward to meeting you!

results.description:
About Team In Training

Our athletes have walked away with new friends, amazing accomplishments and the sense that they did something even more important than getting in good shape. How serious is blood cancer? Every three minutes, someone new is diagnosed with blood cancer. Every 10 minutes, someone dies. In exchange for training and support, you help raise money towards cures for blood cancers leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma -- the No. 1 disease killer of children is leukemia.

The Reason Why

• Coaching and training. Travel to a major marathon, half marathon, century, hiking adventure or triathlon in exciting locations.

• The opportunity to make your athletic goals a reality (an unbeatable offer with great personal rewards).

• A connection with an honored patient so you know just who and what you’re doing it all for.

As the largest endurance sports training program in the world, we will provide you with the experience of a lifetime.

Events 

If you’ve ever wanted to run, walk, or run/walk 26.2, 13.1, or 6.2 miles, now is your chance to join the TEAM that is saving lives. Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for a current listing of our Fall and Winter season events.

Contact

Please contact Margo Cianchetta at margarita.cianchetta@lls.org or 908.956.6628, or visit http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for more information.

GO TEAM!
results.name: Get Fit, Have Fun, and Help Cure Cancer!

results.description:
Looking to spend more time in Bay Ridge? I am, having returned to Brooklyn after a decade in Queens! Perhaps, like me, you do a lot in Manhattan, but wish you could also just hang around the neighborhood with new friends. We  brunch, lunch, and dine in various restaurants in Bay Ridge, as well as go to local community-building events, like concerts and fairs. While the focus is here in Bay Ridge, we venture off to venues in other parts of Brooklyn, like the Brooklyn Museum and the Heights Players. Membership is NOT limited to only those living in Bay Ridge or even Brooklyn, so those "out on the island" or in one of the other boroughs are welcome, too!

Similar to most meetups, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors" has a modest $1 organizing fee per event, payable to me at the start of an event, to offset the subscription cost of maintaining the meetup.

Please note our No-Show Policy: Because we've been kept waiting in lobbies, etc., for folks who didn't bother to change their rsvps, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors"  has a "no-show" policy where any member who incurs ONE no-show with no explanatory emails to me will be permanently removed from our membership rolls and not be allowed to rsvp for any more of our events. After all, would you keep a "friend" who stood you up and never apologized? Let's all respect each other's time and enjoy ourselves with a minimum of discomfort.

Like what you see about "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors "? Then consider joining our sister groups, "Great Places in Gotham" (http://www.meetup.com/The-Great-Places-in-Gotham-Meetup/) , which focuses primarily on Manhattan events and museums, and "Friendly Native New Yorker Walking Tours" (http://www.meetup.com/Friendly-Native-New-Yorker-Walking-Tours/), where as a licensed NYC tour guide, I lead various walking tours in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens!
results.name: The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for people who are interested in learning, relearning, reading in, and speaking classical Latin, the language spoken by the ancient Romans. We're working our way through Hans Ørberg's Lingua Latína per sé illustráta, along with some more advanced reading, and teaching ourselves to speak Latin as we go!

Note: Latin learners of all  levels are welcome. Most of us are beginners.


Hic cupientibus circulus est discere, dénuó discere, loquí linguá Latína quá Rómání antíquí locútí sunt. Libró Hánsis Ørbergis illábórámus Linguá Latíná per sé illustrátá, quibusdam aliís cum léctiunculís, nóbís simul nós loquí docentibus.

N.B.: Discipulí omnés sunt acceptí, nec perítia réfert. Plúrimus nostrum tírónés sumus. 

Sí erró, quæsó, mé corrige!
results.name: Circulus Latínus Noveborácénsis (New York Latin Circle)

results.description:
Polish Friends in NJ is a group for socializing, getting to know each other, making professional connections, and most of all, having fun together. We will wine and dine, go to movies, attend cultural events,  have picnics, and do other activities.

Acknowledgment of Member Responsibility, Express Assumption of Risk, and Release of Liability

By joining Polish Friends in NJ  Meetup Group:

results.description:
This is not a sit around group, this is trial by fire. If you want to get involved in video production, and are an adult of sound mind and body this may be for you. We meet to voluntarily exchange media and production work.

The rules:

RULE #1: You are not a participant, you are a reporter of the news, you do not place your self in danger, you do not place others in danger, you do not personally comment on situations or editorialize, you cover others at the event talking. They are the subject, not any of us in the meetup.

RULE #2: If you want to make sure what you want get's published, either publish it your self on social media, or, convince someone in the group or outside of the group to publish. Just because you are part of the group, does not mean anyone has any obligation to contribute to your work. This is a loosely based meetup.

RULE #3: Bring your skills. If you like being a reporter, if you want to do audio engineering, if you want to write music with true current social meaning, then this is an opportunity.

RULE #4: Try to share your skills with others, there will always be video to produce, if you want to do video production, audio production, anything in the stream to create a news worthy news piece, this is your opportunity.

RULE #5: Do this because you enjoy it, try to have fun, help others, try make meaning of the chaos.

RULE #6: We attend public meeting using Open Meeting Law, in New Jersey this means you can only video speakers or officials, due to NJ draconian laws the public in a meeting has a 'right to privacy' at a meeting. In New York all present at meeting may be recorded.  Recording can not interfere with an orderly meeting. NOTE: Every meeting will generate media to produce, I will generate it and provide it under Creative Commons, so if you are downstream of Video and Audio capture, don't worry, you will always have at least my work to work with.

I started this group when I found out that out of a city of 6+ million, there was no planned coverage of THE Post Ambrose LNG public hearing in Queens. It does not matter if you are a Conservative, Liberal, Progressive or any other affiliation. If you want to get involved with video production, this is an opportunity. For my personal work, I always publish creative commons, unless I included copy write material granted to me specifically for my production. Musicians and Sound engineers are badly needed.

FYI

BE PREPARED! 

Federal and State hearings for unpopular infrastructure projects happen many times in the dead of winter, on the coldest evening with virtually no public transit access.  When I was at the Queens meeting it was dark and in the teens,  I could not imagine any elderly person or sane person taking a multi-link trip to that location, and saw none waiting at bus stop.

If you want to be on the short list of people to be notified of short notice events, contact me.  I always announce on the website, but sometimes less than 24 hours are given in advance notice.
results.name: (All Volunteer) Independent News Media

Bonjour,


This group is all about French culture and activities in New York, and there are a LOT !
You will learn about events, food, people, how to socialize more efficiently to make real life friends, or even find your soul mate (ha ! the French !). This group is also ideal for you if you are new in town.

results.description:
Food and Drink Adventures is geared towards thirty-somethings who want to explore the culinary and nightlife playground that is New York. More than just a drinking and dining-out group, this group is about learning and experiencing all that we consume--as it relates to culture, heritage, history and so much more! 

A few things to note: 

1) Events: All events will be designed to foster friendship.  Dinners will not have large attendance lists, whereas happy hours will not be capped.  

2) Age: This group is intended for people in their 30's.  I'd appreciate it if you respect that. 

3) In an effort to stem the amount of people who RSVP and fail to show up, I’m going to implement the following policy for any person who RSVPs for the 1st time to an event that has a set reservation number and has not shown up to any past events:

When you RSVP as a 1st Timer, I will send you a message to confirm that you will be attending the event. To confirm, simply respond to my message within 48 hours, and you’ll remain on the RSVP list. In the event I do not hear back from you within those 48 hours, if there’s a wait-list, I will remove you from the RSVP list to have someone from the wait-list take your spot.

So please be sure you have your meetup settings allowing me as organizer to send you messages through meetup directly.

4) Removal: If you’re been a member of the group for six months and haven’t RSVP’d or attended a single event, then I reserve the right to remove you from the group. I know that there are a ton of meetup options for one to partake in this great city, but I hope that if you signed up for this group, you’re genuinely interested in giving it a shot – stop by for a drink at one the the next happy hours, or take a chance and try a new cuisine while meeting some new folks. 

Also, if you've RSVP'd to at least 2 meetups, and fail to show up without changing your RSVP and/or notifying me of your absence, I reserve the right to remove you from the group. C'mon, guys - it takes 2 seconds to change your RSVP and/or notify me - I don't have the patience for flaky people - feel free to join another group that will tolerate such behavior.

5) Fees: I think it's lame that meetup has fees to begin with and hasn't figured out a way to generate revenue without holding Head Organizers liable for such costs, but it is what it is...with that being said, I'm not sure if there will be a nominal fee for meetups at some later point in time - as I just took over for the previous organizer, I'm still trying to figure this out.

If all this sounds good to you, then join us! :)
results.name: Food and Drink Adventures (30s)

results.description:
This is a group for girls who live in Greenpoint and Williamsburg. Meetups will include a little bit of everything - dinners, happy hours, fitness activities, shopping, galleries, coffee, festivals, and more! Girls in this group should be in their 20s and 30s only, no exceptions. Most events will have attendance limits, because it's easier to get to know each other in a smaller group! However, don't be discouraged by the waitlist - people tend to cancel in the days right before the event, so you definitely can make it into the events from the waitlist! Inactive members are subject to removal, so please try to make it to some of the events! **I will frequently remove all members who have not even looked at the group page in over a month.** This group will remain small, so we're all able to get to know each other!

*Attendance Policy:

*Respect and consideration for others are Top Priority; be considerate by refraining from being a "NO SHOW" (Not showing up and leaving your RSVP a "yes", or changing RSVP to a "no" within 2 hours of an event and not communicating with the organizer) or a "LATE CANCEL" (Cancelling out of an event within 24 hrs of the event).

*Events take work for organizers to coordinate, especially those requiring RSVPs. Make sure you are able to make it to an event to which you RSVP and if you anticipate a conflict or being late, give us a heads up. We understand that things come up and life interferes, but please do your best. ;)

*If you find that you can't make it to something you've signed up for -- CHANGE YOUR RSVP as soon as possible, or call/text/message an organizer/event host if it is within 2 hours of the event. Events take time & energy to plan. If you don't show up AND make no effort to let the Event Planner know what happened --- that's a "NO SHOW".

*No Show/Late Cancel policy: If you have a history of doing this (we keep track of attendance on your profile), we won't be able to count on you to show up when you say you are going to. Out of respect and courtesy to others that DO show up, we may bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space in favor of those with a positive attendance history. If you make a habit out of no showing or late cancelling, we may remove you from the group.
results.name: Greenpoint Girls

results.description: This meetup is for single, Jewish gay men in their 30's, 40's and 50's. Our purpose is simple: to be a place where single Jewish gay men can meet in fun, no-pressure, no non-sense environments so that they can find that special Jewish someone. For too long, too many Jewish gay men ended up dating non-Jewish men because (a) there aren't that many of out there to begin with;  and (b) with gay couples, starting a family and having a "Jewish home," was not as much a priority as for a heterosexual couple. But now that's changing. More gay couples are starting families. We strive to be an alternative to those events around the City where supposedly one can meet gay Jewish men, but which can be a bit clique-ish (and also very expensive). We also limit our membership to men who are ADULTS - we will take men in their early 30's, but our IDEAL range is really mid-to-late-30's, 40's and 50's.
